Class RandomCrop<T extends TNumber>

java.lang.Object
org.tensorflow.op.RawOp
org.tensorflow.op.image.RandomCrop<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.tensorflow.ndarray.Shaped, Op, Operand<T>
@Operator(group="image") public final class RandomCrop<T extends TNumber> extends RawOp implements Operand<T>
Randomly crop image. size is a 1-D int64 tensor with 2 elements representing the crop height and width. The values must be non negative.

This Op picks a random location in image and crops a height by width rectangle from that location. The random location is picked so the cropped area will fit inside the original image.

    • create

      @Endpoint(describeByClass=true) public static <T extends TNumber> RandomCrop<T> create(Scope scope, Operand<T> image, Operand<TInt64> sizeOutput, RandomCrop.Options... options)
      Factory method to create a class wrapping a new RandomCrop operation.
      Type Parameters:
      T - data type for RandomCrop output and operands
      Parameters:
      scope - current scope
      image - 3-D of shape [height, width, channels].
      sizeOutput - 1-D of length 2 containing: crop_height, crop_width..
      options - carries optional attribute values
      Returns:
      a new instance of RandomCrop

    • seed

      public static RandomCrop.Options seed(Long seed)
      Sets the seed option.
      Parameters:
      seed - If either seed or seed2 are set to be non-zero, the random number generator is seeded by the given seed. Otherwise, it is seeded by a random seed.
      Returns:
      this Options instance.

      Sets the seed2 option.
      Parameters:
      seed2 - An second seed to avoid seed collision.
      Returns:
      this Options instance.

    • asOutput

      public Output<T> asOutput()
      Description copied from interface: Operand
      Returns the symbolic handle of the tensor.

      Inputs to TensorFlow operations are outputs of another TensorFlow operation. This method is used to obtain a symbolic handle that represents the computation of the input.

      Specified by:
      asOutput in interface Operand<T extends TNumber>
      See Also:
      • OperationBuilder.addInput(Output)
